comment: This was an easy class. He does zoom calls every week teaching the material. There are 9 quizzes and 3 exams no lockdown browser and the final is optional.

Very smart teacher but in reality you are paying full time prices for a part time teacher. His classes are pretty straight forward but he would cancel class all the time, grade assignments very late, and wasn't very helpful if you got stuck on a assignment. He does allow you to use your notes during exams but that's pretty much it. Good luck.

Professor Waindi was not the best this year. He doesn't respond so if you need help do not depend on it. He constantly cancelled lectures and still expected us to take quizzes/exams. Not to mention he does not grade assignments, it literally takes him weeks so you will not know your grade until the actual end of the semester.

He struggles with teaching effectively, sometimes canceling classes and moving through material too quickly. His lectures are hard to follow, with not enough examples provided. He assumes all students already understand the content and, rather than explaining it, simply tells them to refer back to a previous chapter if they have questions.

Professor Waindi is an amazing professor! I highly recommend taking his class as you will be looked out for meaning if you put in the effort he is on your side and willing to assist. He is also great with communication. This course was not too difficult as long as you go over your material you will be fine.

This class is a breeze with just a few tough chapters. The main assignments are quizzes and exams. The optional final can replace lowest exam score. There's an optional extra credit that can turn an exam score into a 100. You get 3 quiz attempts. Online, the professor often cancels Teams meetings but posts recorded lectures on lecture days.
Hard to follow his lectures.  If you mess up he will grade harshly and doesn't have sympathy if you forget to submit something even though his due dates don't match the course schedule.

This professor Waindi has a good communication skills, but does not have enough experience of  teaching online students. He does not have enough time to respond to emails. Although he tells students that " if you have any question, please email me." He might reply to your email after 4 -5 days. He skipped a lot assuming that all students know.

I would recommend professor Waindi! His class is only 3 exams and homework throughout the semester online. You don't need to buy the textbook. Attendance isn't mandatory, but going will help you understand the concepts way more. His exams are tough, but he gives partial credit and bonus points. Take him if you get the chance!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Professor Waindi is one of my favorite teachers. He provides a lot of info and presents it in an interesting way. I enjoyed both classes with him and learned a lot. He is approachable and great about communication. Classes are not easy but not hard either.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Do your homework and practice, you will enjoy his class. If you want to be lazy, don't join college. Challenge yourself.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Mr. Waindi wants you to succeed. The class and concepts are hard, but he tries hard to teach you in different ways. Homework is mandatory BUT graded for completion, then going over it after class. He offers lots of extra credit based on the class' performance. If you try, you will get an A in the class! TAKE MR. WAINDI FOR ISYE2600!!

Amazing! He wants you try genuinely learn the material and succeed. He also encourages you to apply principles outside of the classroom. The material can be tough and tests can run long and he will make you work for a good grade. Overall, great professor.
Great professor! He really wants you to learn. The class has 4 test. Open notes, open book, and open PPT test.
Though this class is pretty test-heavy, if you make an effort, they are not that hard. All homework counts as extra credit on the tests, and you have plenty of time to do it. Very sweet teacher.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: No way to fail unless your just lazy. Can pull a C with minimal effort and an A if you do the work. If you struggle with a concept he help. Helps to go to lecture.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Extra Credit opportunities if your willing to put in the work. Super helpful if your having problems. Go to lecture, he clarifies concepts and shows real world applications. If you don't put in the time to learn the concepts you won't make an A. The advanced stat's class builds on everything you learned in this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Would take again

comment: Super relaxed and understanding, uses statistics with real world examples.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Tests? Not many

comment: His tests are absurd and can't be completed in the time allocated. He changes his mind on what you can use during the tests (open book, notes, Excel, etc). He gives you your homework back and all are 100%. Flips back -n-forth through the slides so it is hard to take notes. You must speak up if you are not tracking - will explain or meet.
